hero.title: Designing pathways to powerful solutions
hero.headline_1: I'm a professional designer with 6+ years of experience in design, marketing and branding. My background in social communication and advertising informs my approach to creating solutions that communicate effectively with impact.
hero.headline_2: I love learning about new trends, techniques and technologies that can help me deliver functional and visually appealing solutions that meet user needs and business objectives.

projectsPhrases.there4you: Helping women reclaim their sense of safety
projectsPhrases.becon: Helping businesses to sell more through WhatsApp

about.title: A little about myself...
about.description: Hello. I'm Beatriz! I'm passionate about the universe of design, entrepreneurship, branding, and marketing. I'm always looking to learn more about different things, mainly within this universe. I consider myself a results-oriented Designer with experience in design thinking and human-centered design.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.2012: I started to venture into the digital design just as a hobby
timeline.2018: I was studying pharmacy at the university (I know, nothing to do) until I joined the Junior company of the course in which I started to work voluntarily with marketing and design (it was amazing), that's when I realized that I was in the wrong course
timeline.2019: Year of many changes. I switched my bachelor's course to social communication with a major in advertising. I started working at a junior advertising agency. I started working as a freelance designer. I created my own e-commerce. I participated in my first Startup Weeknd and more…
timeline.2021: I had experience as a volunteer designer at a startup, where I started to delve deeper into UX / UI Design. I participated in an international internship with a great project competition and my team won first place among more than 700 participants.
timeline.2022: Started working at a technology startup, being the principal UX/UI designer.

there4you.title: There4you
there4you.description: A technological, discreet, and creative bracelet that helps women against sexual harassment.

paragraphs.1: (Education and career development software service from Chicago) in partnership with
paragraphs.2: (Business School for Entrepreneurship in Europe) created an entrepreneurship project competition. It was less than one week to create a business idea.
paragraphs.3: My team of 4 girls, developed a Startup idea called
paragraphs.4: , a technological, discreet, and creative bracelet that
paragraphs.7: competed to develop a Startup idea and
paragraphs.9: Overall, I'm proud of this project, it was challenging and we created a business idea that would impact the lives of many women around the world.

role.2: Founder / Graphic designer / Product designer / Designer UX / UI

team.2: Me (Beatriz Moreira); Beatriz Fonseca; Iris Nascimento and Giovanna Savazo

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.subtitle: The project was designed following the

items.1: Seek to understand the needs and wants of the user
items.2: Observation and interviews

items.1: Clear problem statement
Potential solutions
Sketeches, models
items.2: Mockups

items.1: (Future step)
items.2: What works?

items.1: 8 out of 10 women have suffered from sexual harassment worldwide (According to Stop Street Harassment's survey with 996 women)
items.2: The fear of going out alone is universal and constant
items.3: Harassment has many consequences in women's lives such as anxiety, depression and sleep disturbances

solution.title: Solution
solution.subtitle: Product
solution.description: Security bracelet against harassment connected with an app that makes calling for help more agile.

items.1: The device has a USB port (to recharge its battery)
items.2: Connection with the cell phone via bluetooth and functionalities via the app.
items.3: The bracelet has 4 buttons, one for on and off and 3 with the following features
items.4: Sound, emits an alarm (loud and unpleasant sound to scare the aggressor)
items.5: Activate the nearest police station + tracking
items.6: Sends a SOS message to selected contacts and social networks with location tracking

1.name: Vigilant
1.issue: Only sells alarm products with no app technology attached; it does not have a specific audience and has little digital presence.

2.name: Safelet
2.issue: It has a bracelet and an app with technology similar to ours, but the product has only one function button and a few functionalities in the app. In addition, the site and app have an unprofessional design. It has little digital presence.

paragraphs.1: The global self-defense products market size is expected to reach USD 3.6 billion by 2025. Expanding at a CAGR of 5.9% over the forecast period (According to a report by Grand View Research, Inc)..
paragraphs.2: We did research with people around the world (32 women) and discovered that 62.5% have experienced harassment in their lifetime and that 85.7% did not have any self-defense device with them at the moment. Finally, we proposed a gadget with the same functions as THERE4YOU and 87.5% of the people were interested and determined on buying it.

questions.1: Have you experienced any type of harassment and/or abuse?
questions.2: If yes, did you have anything to defend yourself with at the moment?
questions.3: If you had the opportunity to buy a device in the form of a simple bracelet that had the following features (Emit loud sounds; Notify and call the nearest police station; Send SOS messages to selected contacts) would you be interested in buying it?

items.1: That place is very dangerous, I'm not going alone
items.2: There are many unknown men over there, let's change the route
items.3: I'm leaving work a little late, can you pick me up?
items.4: Can you walk me to the bus stop, friend?

items.1: How can I escape if they harass me here?
items.2: How will I call for help quickly if something suspicious happens?
items.3: I need to try to leave early before it gets later and dangerous.
items.4: It is very difficult to be a woman
items.5: If I go out alone I might get harassed
items.6: I can't stand feeling scared anymore

items.1: Share Uber location with people
items.2: Avoid going near unknown men when alone
items.3: Always try to find a company to go somewhere, especially at night
items.4: Avoid going places out of fear

items.1: Unsafe
items.2: Fear

userPersona.title: User persona
userPersona.subtitle: Scenario
userPersona.description: She is a student and works as an intern at a company. She needs to use public transport frequently to get to college and work. She is constantly afraid of being harassed along the way. In the face of this, she is always anxious and feels insecure. She needs something that makes her feel calmer and safer when she leaves the house alone.

1.title: Connection and set up
1.description: Connect your bracelet via Bluetooth and set contacts, social media, and SOS message to be triggered when you are in danger.

2.title: Home
2.description: Map with your location. View reports around you. Locate the nearest police stations. Functions of activating the alarm, sharing location, and calling the police connected to bracelet buttons.

3.title: Community
3.description: Community with reports of harassment complaints to help other victims. The data helps build statistics to understand which places and times are most dangerous, in order to contribute to policing.

4.title: Statistics
4.description: View which places and times are most dangerous.

paragraphs.1: Let's Practice is a brazilian english teaching startup focused on business and entrepreneurship. The brand presents itself as disruptive, determined, and innovative, valuing its purpose of innovating the product “private English classes”, making it more attractive, advantageous, and efficient than face-to-face courses and other platforms currently available.

I worked as a UI/UX designer and volunteer graphic designer at the startup. I was responsible for creating a visual identity and brand guidelines together with another graphic designer. In addition, I was the designer responsible for remodeling the Landing page interface for the brand in partnership with the company's owners and the product manager.

items.1: Lack of a visual identity and brand guidmotion.elines, which resulted in little presence and attractiveness in a very competitive market
items.2: Landing Page visual inconsistency and disorganization
items.3: Lack of prominence in the startup's value proposition within the Landing Page

items.1: Create a visual identity and style guide for the brand
items.2: Enhance brand perception
items.3: Highlight the benefits and competitive advantages of the Startup on the Landing Page
items.4: Create a website navigation flow that is simple and effective for capturing leads

competitors.title: Competitors
competitors.subtitle: Summary of the Landing Page analysis of some competitors, more focused on the navigation and visual experience.

items.1: It is very popular
items.2: The landing page has a good navigation flow
items.3: It doesn't show the price on the page, and a lot of steps need to be taken to get a quote

items.1: A Company that has been in the market for over 20 years
items.2: Interface more clean, fast navigation
items.3: It has very vague information and also doesn't show prices on the page

items.1: Well highlighted testimonials;
items.2: Lots of questions in the FAQ
items.3: There aren't prices on the page;

items.1: It has features interactive onboarding that is very interesting for lead engagement
items.2: There are too many elements on some pages of the interface, which generates a bit of confusion and visual pollution

userEmpathyMap.title: Empathy map
userEmpathyMap.subtitle: Through an interview involving 9 Participants (team people and target audience), some conclusions related to the English class emerged...

items.1: Prefer to study with playful teaching methods
items.2: Seek to learn English for professional qualification.
items.3: Think that English classes are expensive
items.5: Have difficulty following a study routine

painMapItems.1: She has difficulty stopping to study English. Given this, she needs to learn as much as possible in a short time.
painMapItems.2: Her job requires a good level of English and she wants to get a certificate to increase her job opportunities.
painMapItems.3: She doesn't have time to take a full course and also finds it too expensive.
painMapItems.4: She needs a study method that fits into her routine, and that is accessible.

mapOfPleasureItems.1: Yara wants to get a job at her dream company that requires a good level of English.

items.1: User is thinking of improving his English.
items.2: Looking ads for english classes
items.3: Search on social media and google
items.7: Improve page keywords for search results

items.1: Do more research
items.2: Looking into several other English courses
items.4: Confusing web layouts and very general information

items.1: Liked the free trial class and want to do more
items.2: Picks a basic class package and adds it to the cart
items.3: Goes through the check out process
items.4: Checkout page doesn't support many different payment methods
items.6: Work to support more payment methods

items.1: User is thinking about how to fit the classes into his routine
items.2: Creates a schedule in google calendar
items.3: Manually set class times in google calendar
items.5: Automatically and instantly book classes from the website

items.1: The user realizes that his English is improving
items.2: Purchases an advanced class package
items.6: Send an NPS form to understand the level of user satisfaction

paragraphs.1: Becon is a technological startup that has a chatbot platform as a service to help companies to have more control and agility in their services and also to sell more. The platform has several automation features and integrations.

items.1: When I joined the startup team, it was in a process of changes related to its growth. The company was changing its visual identity to present itself as more modern and reliable and needed these attributes to be part of the platform's interfaces, such as the login page.
items.2: There is a visual mismatch between the login interface and the brand’s new identity, which could affect the perception of cohesiveness.
items.3: The platform has customizable interfaces according to the two main brand colors of each company/client. Therefore, the challenge of creating an interface that is adaptable and coherent for this situation arises.
items.4: The interface needs to be customizable, adaptable and have good readability, legibility and visual consistency for different situations

items.1: Create a more professional, modern, reliable and customizable interface

userPersona.title: User persona
userPersona.subtitle: Characteristics
userPersona.description: A modern entrepreneur, has a good technological aptitude, analyzes a platform a lot before buying, is demanding with the product, and is not afraid to change platforms if he is not satisfied. Dislikes complexities in the onboarding process. He is proactive and open to new ideas.

beforeAndAfter.title: Before and after
beforeAndAfter.description: I have defined a recommended color palette for the platform that is compatible with different visual identities and with the neutral system default colors.
